TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit VariationLabel extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents Variation Label objects that are managed from the "/_layouts/VariationLabels.aspx" page.

example.code: Reference code on how to use this property can be found in "/_controltemplates/VariationRootLanding.ascx".

MemberSignature.Value: public string DisplayName { get; }
.property instance string DisplayName
Public ReadOnly Property DisplayName As String
public: property System::String ^ DisplayName { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the user interface (UI) display name of the label.
Docs.value: UI display name of the Label.

remarks.para: The value of this property defaults to the value of the Title property. This property is used by the predefined VariationsLabelMenu control to render the "Flag" control.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool IsSource { get; }
.property instance bool IsSource
Public ReadOnly Property IsSource As Boolean
public: property bool IsSource { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Determines whether the Variation Label is set as the source label.
Docs.value: Boolean value that indicates whether this is a source Variation Label.

example.code: Reference code on how to use this property can be found in "/_controltemplates/VariationRootLanding.ascx".

MemberSignature.Value: public string Language { get; }
.property instance string Language
Public ReadOnly Property Language As String
public: property System::String ^ Language { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the Language of the Variation Label.
Docs.value: The Language value of the Variation Label, in the format "languagecode2-country/regioncode2" that follows the RFC 1766 standard, where "languagecode2" is a lowercase two-letter code derived from ISO 639-1 and "country/regioncode2" is an uppercase two-letter code derived from ISO 3166. The value can be used to instantiate System.Globalization.CultureInfo objects by name.

remarks.para: This property affects which localized version of Site Template is used when creating a site for this Variation Label.

example.code: Reference code on how to use this property can be found in "/_controltemplates/VariationRootLanding.ascx".

MemberSignature.Value: public string Locale { get; }
.property instance string Locale
Public ReadOnly Property Locale As String
public: property System::String ^ Locale { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the Locale of the Variation Label.
Docs.value: String value of the Locale of the Variation Label, in the format of the locale identifier number that can be used to instantiate System.Globalization.CultureInfo objects by culture identifier.

remarks.para: This property affects the Locale value set on the Site (SPWeb) when creating Site for this Variation Label.

example.code: Reference code on how to use this property can be found in "/_controltemplates/VariationRootLanding.ascx".

MemberSignature.Value: public string Title { get; }
.property instance string Title
Public ReadOnly Property Title As String
public: property System::String ^ Title { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the title of the Variation Label, which is the unique string identifier of the label.
Docs.value: The unique name of the Variation Label.

MemberSignature.Value: public string TopWebUrl { get; }
.property instance string TopWebUrl
Public ReadOnly Property TopWebUrl As String
public: property System::String ^ TopWebUrl { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the URL of the top Publishing Web of the variation hierarchy of this label.
Docs.value: URL of the top Publishing Web of the variation hierarchy of this label.

example.code: Reference code on how to use this property can be found in "/_controltemplates/VariationRootLanding.ascx".
